item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Kelly add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I felt like a racehorse in a world without racetracks or a champion college footballer suddenly confronted by Wall Street and a business suit, his days of glory shrunk to a little gold cup on his mantel with a date engraved on it like the date on a tombstone." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Life has been some combination of fairy-tale coincidence and joie de vivre and shocks of beauty together with some hurtful self-questioning." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "because wherever I sat—on the deck of a ship or at a street café in Paris or Bangkok—I would be sitting under the same glass bell jar, stewing in my own sour air." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Is anyone anywhere happy?" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "How frail the human heart must be―a mirrored pool of thought." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "That is all I want in life: for this pain to seem purposeful." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "Sometimes I wish I could walk around with a HANDLE WITH CARE sign stuck to my forehead." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "I need the thing that happens when your brain shuts off and your heart turns on." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "I am crying over the elusive nature of love." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "I feel like a defective model, like I came off the assembly line flat-out fucked and my parents should have taken me back for repairs before the warranty ran out." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Naomi Wolf
item.description: "A Mother who radiates self-love and self-acceptance actually VACCINATES her daughter against low self-esteem. " -- Naomi Wolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "<i>April the 4th, 1984. </i> To the past, or to the future. To an age when thought is free. From the Age of Big Brother, from the Age of the Thought Police, from a dead man - greetings!" -- George Orwell

item.title: Kelly add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In real life it is always the anvil that breaks the hammer..." -- George Orwell

item.title: Kelly add a quote by George orwell
item.description: "To an ordinary human being, love means nothing if it does not mean loving some people more than others" -- George orwell
